tags: im so Tired of seeing her interpreted as an anti social loner
and of having her girlhood disregarded
summary: also i keep reading in these goddess archetype books about the connection between community and the feminine. which makes sense....
body: also i keep reading in these goddess archetype books about the connection between community and the feminine. which makes sense. women (for better of worse) are associated with nurturing, motherhood, and family. the larger sense of community is just on a greater scale. and thats what arya is all about. her objective is her pack. its being a part of a community; protecting and providing for each other. also learning from and listening to members of the community which we see arya doing from winterfell to braavos. arya’s core value, community, is actually feminine in nature.

summary: La muerte no es lo peor que nos puede pasar -le respondió el hombre bondadoso-. Es su regalo para nosotros, el fin de los...
body:
La muerte no es lo peor que nos puede pasar -le respondió el hombre bondadoso-. Es su regalo para nosotros, el fin de los anhelos y el dolor. El día en que nacemos, el Dios de Muchos Rostros nos envía a cada uno un ángel oscuro que recorre la vida a nuestro lado. Cuando nuestros pecados y sufrimientos son una carga demasiado grande, él ángel nos toma de la mano y nos lleva a las tierras de la noche, donde las estrellas brillan siempre. Los que vienen a beber de l Copa negra están buscando a sus ángeles. Si tienen miedo, las velas los tranquilizan. ¿En qué piensas cuando hueles las velas, mi niña?

《En Invernalia -le podría haber respondido-. Huele a la risas de Hodor, y a Jon y a Robb entrenándose juntos en el patio, y a Sansa cantando alguna canción idiota sobre alguna bella dama. Huelen a las criptas donde están los reyes de piedra; huelen a pan caliente en el horno; huelen al bosque de dioses. Huelen a mi loba y huelen a su pelaje; es casi como si la tuviera al lado.》

El día en que nacemos, el Dios de Muchos Rostros nos envía a cada uno un ángel oscuro que recorre la vida a nuestro lado. Cuando nuestros pecados y sufrimientos son una carga demasiado grande, él ángel nos toma de la mano y nos lleva a las tierras de la noche, donde las estrellas brillan siempre. Los que vienen a beber de l Copa negra están buscando a sus ángeles. Si tienen miedo, las velas los tranquilizan. ¿En qué piensas cuando hueles las velas, mi niña?

《En Invernalia -le podría haber respondido-. Huele a la risas de Hodor, y a Jon y a Robb entrenándose juntos en el patio, y a Sansa cantando alguna canción idiota sobre alguna bella dama. Huelen a las criptas donde están los reyes de piedra; huelen a pan caliente en el horno; huelen al bosque de dioses. Huelen a mi loba y huelen a su pelaje; es casi como si la tuviera al lado.》

blog.name: i-crossed-the-narrow-sea
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description: I'm here mostly for Arya x Jaqen or Jaqarya, if you prefer, amazing fanfiction authors whose stories help me to deal with the damage the showmakers did to Arya and Jaqen storyline, especially Braavos part. Obsessed with Jaqen H'ghar and Arya Stark and the House of Black and White ;) I love Braavos above all and I hope Arya and Jaqen story will be much better in the next book than what we've got so far in the show. I also love Tyrion  Lannister (really hope he'll get better lines next season), Jon Snow and ser Bronn of the Blackwater. I ship Arya and Jaqen, Tyrion and Tysha (I believe there is hope for them in the book) , Jaime and Brienne, Sansa and Sandor though I also like the idea of Sansa reuniting with Tyrion. I believe Rhaegar Targaryen never raped  Lyanna Stark but saved her from awful Robert Baratheon.

summary: She had never cared if she was pretty, even when she was stupid Arya Stark. Only her father had ever called her that. Him, and...
body:
She had never cared if she was pretty, even when she was stupid Arya Stark. Only her father had ever called her that. Him, and Jon Snow, sometimes. Her mother used to say she could be pretty if she would just wash and brush her hair and take more care with her dress, the way her sister did. To her sister and sister’s friends and all the rest, she had just been Arya Horseface.

                                                     –A Dance with Dragons- The Blind Girl

I always get sad when I remember that only Ned and Jon reminded Arya that she was pretty as she grew up. And I get extra sad that she never had her mother’s support because all little girls need an older supportive female figure in their life.

summary: The Red Hood - Eanna23je - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Red Hood - Eanna23je - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Another chapter of The Red Hood is up today! Hope everyone’s been enjoying my flight of fairytale/ASOIAF fancy. It’s way too much fun, and has been a fun way to practice free writing when I need a break from the real books ;) P.S. Jonrya is a bit of an odd pairing for some people, and that’s cool if so. I fell in love with them after discovering some great fics, not long after GRRM’s original outline for the books came out. And I’ve always been such a sucker for rare pairs. So now I’m sailing with this ship ;)

Chapter 4 Summary:

Arya is finally brought to the Wolf King’s lair, and it’s not quite what she expected. Neither is Jon, who seems to care far more than he should. But can she trust him?

The Red Hood Summary:

It has been seven years since Ned Stark was declared a traitor to the crown and sentenced to the Wall. Now Winter is here and creatures of legend have been stirring in the North. The Three-Eyed Raven told her mother to make Arya a red cloak to protect her on her journey to see Ned. The red hood will keep her safe, the trees whisper. But the long night is indeed dark, and the road north full of terrors. Forced to face the Others, Arya is convinced the cloak will be the death of her. Until the Wolf King and his pack save her life. The price the Wolf King demands for saving her life is high, however, and the bargain struck may cost Arya more than she is willing to give.

blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Hey! I was just rereading your asoiaf/Hogwarts AU and (sorry if you've said before) but I was wondering which house you put the...
question: Hey! I was just rereading your asoiaf/Hogwarts AU and (sorry if you've said before) but I was wondering which house you put the Starklings in?
answer:
Aw, thank you! And to answer your question, I once wrote out what House I thought each Starkling should be in, but I lost that paper, so I have to with my gut right now in this moment. (Plus, that was like 5 years ago, I would probably disagree with at least one of them, and still have to remake it lol)

Robb is a pure Gryffindor to me. Bran a pure Ravenclaw. Like, I do not doubt these two at all and I will stand by these Houses to the end.

I can’t really get a read on Rickon’s House. I don’t think he would be in Ravenclaw or Slytherin, probably a Gryff or a Puff, but he’s so young in the books and also not a POV character, so it’s hard to get a good grasp on his core personality traits that could help determine a House. We mainly get wild, which suggests Gryffindor, but I still don’t know. I feel Gryffindor wins, but it’s close.

Arya I feel would be both a good Gryffindor and a good Hufflepuff. I would accept either one of these in a story, and I don’t really have a preference. I Sort her into Hufflepuff just to have a good mix with all the Houses for the Starklings, but I also think she would have been a close Gryffindor and the Sorting Hat took their time in Sorting her before making a final decision.

Sansa is like Arya, a mix between two Houses and a good fit for both, these two being Ravenclaw and Slytherin. As a Slytherin and one whose favorite character is Sansa, I Sort her into Slytherin. Plus as I mentioned with Arya, it gives a Stark to each House, with Rickon honestly going anywhere, but for my sake Gryffindor.

And then last, but so not least, Jon. He actually has the exact opposite problem as Rickon. I actually find it hard to Sort Jon into a House because I find he fits into all of them well. I truly don’t care what House he’s in.

That said, my inner Jonsa shipper finds the idea of Sansa and Jon in Slytherin, both good people grabbling with the history of the House and what their place in the future could be. Sansa from a line of Starks (never concentrated into one House, but they would never be a Slytherin), finding herself under the tutelage of Charms Professor Baelish, and Jon, the scion of well-gossiped about affair between Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Snow, (a Stark cousin in fact) who doesn’t want to follow in the footsteps of his family, but doesn’t see a way out until he meets a Hufflepuff in need, Samwell Tarly.

But that’s not the asoiaf/hp fusion series, and for that, I think Jon could be in any House, and probably Gryffindor just based on gut feeling.

Does that help?

(To be probably too nerdy, I also calculated where each Starkling would be with each other by year. Assuming their ages go within their actual school years [as we don’t know birthdays, and if one was born in September or August to bring them down or up by a year], it would be:

Sansa’s First year-Robb and Jon are fourth years

Arya’s first year-Sansa is a third year, Robb and Jon are sixth years

Bran’s first year-Arya is a third year, Sansa is a fifth year

Rickon’s first year-Bran is a fifth year, Arya is a seventh year)

reblog.comment:
Aw, thank you! And to answer your question, I once wrote out what House I thought each Starkling should be in, but I lost that paper, so I have to with my gut right now in this moment. (Plus, that was like 5 years ago, I would probably disagree with at least one of them, and still have to remake it lol)

Robb is a pure Gryffindor to me. Bran a pure Ravenclaw. Like, I do not doubt these two at all and I will stand by these Houses to the end.

I can’t really get a read on Rickon’s House. I don’t think he would be in Ravenclaw or Slytherin, probably a Gryff or a Puff, but he’s so young in the books and also not a POV character, so it’s hard to get a good grasp on his core personality traits that could help determine a House. We mainly get wild, which suggests Gryffindor, but I still don’t know. I feel Gryffindor wins, but it’s close.

Arya I feel would be both a good Gryffindor and a good Hufflepuff. I would accept either one of these in a story, and I don’t really have a preference. I Sort her into Hufflepuff just to have a good mix with all the Houses for the Starklings, but I also think she would have been a close Gryffindor and the Sorting Hat took their time in Sorting her before making a final decision.

Sansa is like Arya, a mix between two Houses and a good fit for both, these two being Ravenclaw and Slytherin. As a Slytherin and one whose favorite character is Sansa, I Sort her into Slytherin. Plus as I mentioned with Arya, it gives a Stark to each House, with Rickon honestly going anywhere, but for my sake Gryffindor.

And then last, but so not least, Jon. He actually has the exact opposite problem as Rickon. I actually find it hard to Sort Jon into a House because I find he fits into all of them well. I truly don’t care what House he’s in.

That said, my inner Jonsa shipper finds the idea of Sansa and Jon in Slytherin, both good people grabbling with the history of the House and what their place in the future could be. But that’s not the asoiaf/hp fusion series, and for that, I think Jon could be in any House, and probably Gryffindor just based on gut feeling.

Does that help?

(To be probably too nerdy, I also calculated where each Starkling would be with each other by year. Assuming their ages go within their actual school years [as we don’t know birthdays, and if one was born in September or August to bring them down or up by a year], it would be:

Bran’s first year-Arya is a third year, Sansa is a fifth year

Rickon’s first year-Bran is a fifth year, Arya is a seventh year)

summary: Arya Stark is the best character
body:
Arya Stark is the best character

I’m almost done with the third book and I havent seen the show, except Arya was annoyed with a villager girl so she ripped her doll apart and it’s my favorite thing shes ever done

'Game of Thrones & a Parting Glass' lives here, don't ask why, but you can search by character or author if you wish. and sometimes i snap photos, write words, and paint pictures. and sometimes i realize it's all futile. <!-- Start of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->

summary: Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU: “Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?” “Oh yeah. A couple of times.” The Stark...
caption:
Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU:

“Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?”

“Oh yeah. A couple of times.”

The Stark sisters were born into a life of magic. After their mother dies of a broken heart the pragmatic Arya swears to never fall in love while the dreamy Sansa can’t wait for romance. A singularly gifted witch, Arya chooses to stay at the Winterfell manor and carry on the family business of witchcraft. Sansa leaves home for an exciting life in the big city where she charms everyone she meets and draws the attention of a mysterious, but dangerous man. He brings dark and unnatural forces into the sisters life. And a young detective. Gendry Waters is investigating the strange circumstances surrounding Arya and she can’t help but be drawn to him too. Together Arya and Sansa will defeat an ancient evil, break the curse…and discover true love.
